svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - July 13 2018
News and Links
Protocol
• Ben Edgington’s slides on the path to Ethereum 2.0
Ben Edgington’s slides on the path to Ethereum 2.0
• TechCrunch Karl, Vitalik, and Justin scalability panel, where Justin estimated timeline at Casper in
2019, sharding in 2020.
TechCrunch Karl, Vitalik, and Justin scalability panel, where Justin estimated timeline at Casper in
• Justin Drake’s latest sharding slides
Justin Drake’s latest sharding slides
• Prymsatic’s sharding implementation update .
Prymsatic’s sharding implementation update .

draft of OMG Plasma’s Simple Fast Withdrawals

Wolk’s Plasma Cash implementation
• Latest Casper standup
Latest Casper standup
• Latest core dev call . Lane’s amazing notes . ewasm testnet before Devcon. Pegasys announced that
by Devcon it would release its mainnet client written in Java.
Latest core dev call . Lane’s amazing notes . ewasm testnet before Devcon. Pegasys announced that
• It appears that next hard fork will include 145, 1052, 1014 EIPs and aiming for before Devcon
It appears that next hard fork will include 145, 1052, 1014 EIPs and aiming for before Devcon

Stuff for developers
• Zero knowledge identity and signaling on top of Miximus, from BarryWhitehat

web3 webpacked

basic syntax mode in emacs for Vyper

• Quorum devs want to know what questions you have for them

• SolidStamp report on security auditors
SolidStamp report on security auditors
• Signup to be a Connext Hub in their payment channel pilot program
Signup to be a Connext Hub in their payment channel pilot program
• Building an Eth account scraper with QuickBlocks (now open source!)
Building an Eth account scraper with QuickBlocks (now open source!)
• Decentralize wallet.ethereum.org using IPFS with Dappnode
Decentralize wallet.ethereum.org using IPFS with Dappnode
Release
• Geth v1.8.12 - add Swarm PoC3 plus performance and bug fixes
Live on mainnet
• Augur is live . Over 100k open interest, total volume heading towards a million. Definitely some
bugs being worked through which lead to Augur App v1.0.2 . Very cool to see people building stuff on
top like predictions.global
Ecosystem
• Gitcoin put up a nice time to confirmation gas history chart . My 1 gwei transaction finally went
through after 12 days, so perhaps the offending exchange has decided to stop incentivizing spamming
the chain and the gas crisis is over?
Gitcoin put up a nice time to confirmation gas history chart . My 1 gwei transaction finally went
• Vitalik’s slides on transaction fee economics
Vitalik’s slides on transaction fee economics
• Poor Bancor key management leads to loss of 25k ETH (~12m usd)
Poor Bancor key management leads to loss of 25k ETH (~12m usd)
• Parimutuel Eth betting on the World Cup final
Parimutuel Eth betting on the World Cup final
• Sergey Brin is mining Ethereum with his son
Sergey Brin is mining Ethereum with his son
• Trusted 3rd parties are security holes: hacked Hola Chrome extension logged MyEtherWallet activity
Trusted 3rd parties are security holes: hacked Hola Chrome extension logged MyEtherWallet activity
• MyCrypto v1.2 release with hardware wallet support and no more private keys option on the web
MyCrypto v1.2 release with hardware wallet support and no more private keys option on the web
• web3 design collaboration call
web3 design collaboration call
• Jérôme de Tychey’s Ethereum and scalability overview slides
Jérôme de Tychey’s Ethereum and scalability overview slides
Governance and Standards
• EIP1193 : Ethereum provider API
EIP1193 : Ethereum provider API
• EIP1121 : Add chain id to EIP55 mixed-case checksum address encoding
EIP1121 : Add chain id to EIP55 mixed-case checksum address encoding
• EIP1218 : extend BLOCKHASH opcode so blocks are aware of block hashes much older than current hash.
alternative to EIP210
EIP1218 : extend BLOCKHASH opcode so blocks are aware of block hashes much older than current hash.
• ERC1201 : 2 tier token structure for NFT ownership and rental
ERC1201 : 2 tier token structure for NFT ownership and rental
• ERC1202 : Voting standard
ERC1202 : Voting standard
• ERC1200 : token upgradeability standard
ERC1200 : token upgradeability standard
• ERC1214 : another token upgradeability standard
ERC1214 : another token upgradeability standard
• ERC1203 : multi-class token standard
ERC1203 : multi-class token standard
• ERC1207 : DAuth Access Delegation standard
ERC1207 : DAuth Access Delegation standard
• ERC1211 : Common Ownership Self-Assessed Tax (COST) interface
ERC1211 : Common Ownership Self-Assessed Tax (COST) interface

Comparison of top-down and bottom-up composables

Matt Lockyer’s argument against onchain token standards

Ryan Zurrer argues for EIP999 , or something like it
• Aragon: On signaling and social pressure . Pick a group of stakeholders, make a DAO with them, hold
vote.

Project Updates
• Intrinsic vs extrinsic motivation in Gitcoin. $150k in lifetime work done.
Intrinsic vs extrinsic motivation in Gitcoin. $150k in lifetime work done.
• OmiseGo monthly update
OmiseGo monthly update
• Rocketpool to do a beta test on their own PoA testnet
Rocketpool to do a beta test on their own PoA testnet
• Brave passes 3.1m MAUs , 80% mobile. Mobile is a no-brainer, but as of late desktop is also nearing
no-brainer territory. And they’ve left anti-blockchain Mailchimp , hurray!
Brave passes 3.1m MAUs , 80% mobile. Mobile is a no-brainer, but as of late desktop is also nearing
• Opera announces built-in web3 crypto wallet, but all their blog posts have been down for … days.
Opera announces built-in web3 crypto wallet, but all their blog posts have been down for … days.
• Grid+ alpha to go live soon with three groups : electricity-only, electricity with Grid+ agent, and
just agent. First 2 are Texas-only, but third group is for US residents to test the agent as a
hardware wallet.
Grid+ alpha to go live soon with three groups : electricity-only, electricity with Grid+ agent, and
• Mysterium has launched on testnet for 3rd party vpn nodes. How to host a VPN node
Mysterium has launched on testnet for 3rd party vpn nodes. How to host a VPN node
• Smart GPU miners may make lots of money transcode mining with Livepeer
Smart GPU miners may make lots of money transcode mining with Livepeer
• Kyber Network on its goal of making tokens liquid and useful
Kyber Network on its goal of making tokens liquid and useful
• Golem on running arbitrary payloads in SGX enclaves
Golem on running arbitrary payloads in SGX enclaves

• All the interviews at TechCrunch Zug . Lots of good stuff there

Connext’s Arjun Bhuptani on Inchained

Patrick McCorry talks Pisa

• Joe Lubin “Power of Ethereum” keynote at Rise in HK. More Joe on Blockchain and Us podcast, which
I love because there’s a transcript.

love because there’s a transcript.
Tokens
• Interesting look at the token models of Asian exchanges
Interesting look at the token models of Asian exchanges

• Big Tech will drive web3 adoption . Interesting ideas, but I bet Clay Christensen would disagree.

• Could tokenized ownership for renters solve the principal-agent problem the way stock options
(theoretically) incentivize employees?
Could tokenized ownership for renters solve the principal-agent problem the way stock options
• Delegating votes to overcome TCR vote-splitting problem
Delegating votes to overcome TCR vote-splitting problem
• Panvala is a TCR for code security from ConsenSys Diligence, with the twist of a token capacitor to
reward participants at decaying rate. Sale in a few months. Interesting experiment.
Panvala is a TCR for code security from ConsenSys Diligence, with the twist of a token capacitor to
• Equity or equity-replicating tokens given to early adopters is a trend we’re starting to see and
will likely see more of. Two I find interesting are Dapped for dapp discovery and Open Bundle for
journalism from some of my old co-workers at Ticketleap. They also wrote: When protocols replace
companies
Equity or equity-replicating tokens given to early adopters is a trend we’re starting to see and will
likely see more of. Two I find interesting are Dapped for dapp discovery and Open Bundle for

• Luxarity working with ConsenSys to track physical and monetary donations, then sell the physical
donations at retail, and track social impact disbursements. Also from ConsenSys asia tour: Caifeng
gene data exchange with Kaleido

and ConsenSys venture

If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re interested.
Editorial control is 100% me. If you’re unhappy with editorial decisions, feel free to tweet at me.
Shameless self-promotion
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
